title: Getting Started with pKOI
text: pKOI (Proteomic Knowledge-Graph Omics Integration) network-based enrichment analysis tool integrates differential proteomics data heterogeneous biological knowledge graph. uses personalized PageRank algorithm prioritize annotate biologically relevant nodes (e.g., genes, diseases, pathways, cell types) connected significant proteins. vignette demonstrates typical use case pKOI input preparation result interpretation.

title: Getting Started with pKOI
text: input data.frame differential proteomics results, must include: uniprot_id: Unique UniProt identifier protein logfc: Log fold-change value p_value: P-value differential expression

title: Getting Started with pKOI
text: Use run_pkoi() analyze proteomics data default pKOI knowledge graph: process: Filters proteomics dataset Computes personalized PageRank significant proteins Simulates null distribution using topological matching Calculates empirical statistics Annotates network nodes ontology-based information
code: result = run_pkoi(   proteomics_data = example_data1,   pvalue_threshold = 0.01,   logfc_threshold = 0,   topology_by = "degree",   topology_similarity = 0.9,   n_permutation = 10,   damping_factor = 0.85,   maximum_iteration = 500,   subnetwork = pkoi_net,   include_subnetwork = FALSE )

title: Getting Started with pKOI
text: output S4 object class pKOIList: access annotated results: element list corresponds node type (e.g., “Anatomy”, “Pathway”, “Protein”). ’s example inspecting enriched pathways: table contains:

title: Getting Started with pKOI
text: topology_by parameter controls algorithm matches sham proteins null simulation. Available options include: "degree": number direct neighbors "coreness": node’s k-core value "betweenness": number shortest paths node "closeness": inverse distance nodes "constraint": structural redundancy neighborhood "eccentricity": longest shortest path node "eigen_centrality": importance based neighbors’ influence "transitivity": local clustering coefficient Example using "betweenness":

title: Getting Started with pKOI
text: can visualize export enriched node table:

title: Getting Started with pKOI
text: pKOI provides flexible interpretable framework identifying biologically relevant features proteomic data using graph-based approach. integrating ontology-based annotations network topology permutation-based null models, offers robustness biological context. questions contributions, email Wanjun Gu

title: Authors and Citation
text: Wanjun Gu. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Gu W (2025). pkoi: Proteomics Knowledge-Graph Omics Integration Human Pathway Analysis. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {pkoi: Proteomics Knowledge-Graph Omics Integration for Human Pathway Analysis},   author = {Wanjun Gu},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

title: pKOI
text: pKOI (Proteomic Knowledge-Graph Omics Integration) R package integrates differential proteomics data heterogeneous biological knowledge graph. identifies biologically enriched nodes pathways using personalized PageRank propagation, topological null simulations, ontology annotations.

title: pKOI
text: can install development version pKOI GitHub using: Make sure system dependencies installed igraph, dplyr, data.table, purrr, knitr.

title: pKOI
text: core function package run_pkoi(), : Filters differential proteomics data significance. Maps proteins biological network. Computes personalized PageRank using effect sizes. Performs permutation testing simulate network background. Annotates significantly enriched nodes ontology information.

title: pKOI
text: output pKOIList S4 object following slots: proteomics_data: input data UniProt IDs, logFC, p-values. network_summary_statistics: list data frames annotated node type (e.g., Disease, Anatomy, GO terms). subnetwork (optional): full igraph object include_subnetwork = TRUE.
code: library(pkoi)  # Run pKOI on example proteomics data result = run_pkoi(   proteomics_data = pkoi::example_data1,   pvalue_threshold = 0.01,   logfc_threshold = 0,   topology_by = "degree",   topology_similarity = 0.9,   n_permutation = 10,   damping_factor = 0.85,   maximum_iteration = 500,   subnetwork = pkoi::pkoi_net,   include_subnetwork = FALSE )

title: pKOI
text: input proteomics_data data.frame following columns: uniprot_id: character vector UniProt IDs logfc: numeric log fold-change values p_value: numeric significance values Example:

title: pKOI
text: output object includes annotated tables various biological node types, : Anatomy Disease Biological Process Molecular Function Cell Type Compound Clinical Lab Pathway Protein Domain / Family table contains:

title: pKOI
text: use pKOI research, please cite: Wanjun Gu. pKOI: Proteomic Knowledge-Graph Omics Integration, UCSF, 2025. DOI: Coming soon

title: pKOI
text: package distributed MIT license. See LICENSE file details.

title: pKOI
text: Created maintained Wanjun Gu.

what: Anatomical Entity Annotations from UBERON — anatomy_annotation
title: Anatomical Entity Annotations from UBERON — anatomy_annotation
text: curated annotation table anatomical entities sourced UBERON ontology. dataset provides standard identifiers, human-readable names, textual definitions anatomical structures. used within pKOI analysis pipeline enrich network nodes type "Anatomy" biological context ontology-based metadata.

title: Anatomical Entity Annotations from UBERON — anatomy_annotation
Anatomical Entity Annotations from UBERON — anatomy_annotation
text: data frame 15,668 rows 3 columns: identifier character string representing UBERON ontology identifier (e.g., "UBERON:0000002"). name human-readable name anatomical structure (e.g., "uterine cervix"). definition character string describing biological definition functional role anatomical entity.

title: Anatomical Entity Annotations from UBERON — anatomy_annotation
text: UBERON Ontology http://uberon.github.io/

title: Anatomical Entity Annotations from UBERON — anatomy_annotation
text: dataset supports annotation interpretation graph nodes labeled anatomical concepts biological networks. can joined results using `identifier` column enhance interpretability enriched prioritized nodes.

code: data(anatomy_annotation) head(anatomy_annotation) #>       identifier                name #> 1 UBERON:0000000   processual entity #> 2 UBERON:0000002      uterine cervix #> 3 UBERON:0000003               naris #> 4 UBERON:0000004                nose #> 5 UBERON:0000005  chemosensory organ #> 6 UBERON:0000006 islet of Langerhans #>                                                                                                                                        definition #> 1 An occurrent [span:Occurrent] that exists in time by occurring or happening, has temporal parts and always involves and depends on some entity. #> 2                                                              Lower, narrow portion of the uterus where it joins with the top end of the vagina. #> 3                                      Orifice of the olfactory system. The naris is the route by which odorants enter the olfactory system[MAH]. #> 4     The olfactory organ of vertebrates, consisting of nares, olfactory epithelia and the structures and skeletal framework of the nasal cavity. #> 5                                                                                                                                                 #> 6                                                             The clusters of hormone-producing cells that are scattered throughout the pancreas.

title: Cell Type Ontology Annotations (CL) — celltype_annotation
text: structured annotation table cell types based Cell Ontology (CL). dataset provides standardized identifiers, names, detailed biological definitions various cell types, including epithelial cells, immune cells, specialized sensory cells. used pKOI framework annotate nodes labeled cell types support network enrichment interpretation cell-specific biological functions.

title: Cell Type Ontology Annotations (CL) — celltype_annotation
text: data frame 3,058 rows 3 columns: identifier character string representing CL (Cell Ontology) identifier (e.g., "CL:0000001"). name standardized name cell type (e.g., "primary cultured cell"). definition textual definition cell type, including functional roles, structural features, biological context. Obsolete terms clearly indicated.

title: Cell Type Ontology Annotations (CL) — celltype_annotation
text: Cell Ontology (CL) https://obophenotype.github.io/cell-ontology/

title: Cell Type Ontology Annotations (CL) — celltype_annotation
text: dataset includes wide variety cell types, generic terms like "cell" highly specialized cells "tuft cell olfactory epithelium." Obsolete terms retained ontology completeness excluded downstream functional analyses unless specifically required. annotations can joined graph-based analysis results using `identifier` column, facilitating biological interpretation network analysis.

title: Cell Type Ontology Annotations (CL) — celltype_annotation
code: data(celltype_annotation) subset(celltype_annotation, grepl("olfactory", name)) #>      identifier #> 201  CL:0000207 #> 610  CL:0000626 #> 825  CL:0000847 #> 826  CL:0000848 #> 827  CL:0000849 #> 831  CL:0000853 #> 1229 CL:0002167 #> 1231 CL:0002169 #> 1233 CL:0002171 #> 1246 CL:0002184 #> 2104 CL:0011028 #> 2476 CL:1001434 #> 2483 CL:1001503 #> 2828 CL:4030051 #> 2829 CL:4030052 #> 3054 CL:4052037 #>                                                                       name #> 201                                                olfactory receptor cell #> 610                                                 olfactory granule cell #> 825                                     ciliated olfactory receptor neuron #> 826                                 microvillous olfactory receptor neuron #> 827                                        crypt olfactory receptor neuron #> 831                                   olfactory epithelial supporting cell #> 1229                                             olfactory epithelial cell #> 1231                                    basal cell of olfactory epithelium #> 1233                                  globose cell of olfactory epithelium #> 1246                             basal proper cell of olfactory epithelium #> 2104                                            olfactory ensheathing cell #> 2476                                            olfactory bulb interneuron #> 2483                                            olfactory bulb tufted cell #> 2828 nucleus accumbens shell and olfactory tubercle D1 medium spiny neuron #> 2829 nucleus accumbens shell and olfactory tubercle D2 medium spiny neuron #> 3054                                     tuft cell of olfactory epithelium #>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   definition #> 201                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               Any neuron that is capable of some detection of chemical stimulus involved in sensory perception of smell. #> 610                                                                                                                                                                    A granule cell that has a soma located in an olfactory bulb granule cell layer. An olfactory granule cell is an interneuron that lacks an axon, makes reciprocal dendro-dendritic synapses with mitral cells and tufted cells and is involved in the fine spatio-temporal tuning of the responses of these principal olfactory bulb neurons to odors. #> 825                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           An olfactory receptor cell in which the apical ending of the dendrite is a pronounced ciliated olfactory knob. #> 826                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          An olfactory receptor cell in which the apical ending of the dendrite is a knob that bears numerous microvilli. #> 827                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           An olfactory receptor cell with short cilia growing in an invagination bordered by microvilli. #> 831                Olfactory epithelial support cell is a columnar cell that extends from the epithelial free margin to the basement membrane of the olfactory epithelium. This cell type has a large, vertically, elongate, euchromatic nucleus, along with other nuclei, forms a layer superficial to the cell body of the receptor cell; sends long somewhat irregular microvilli into the mucus layer; at the base, with expanded end-feet containing numerous lamellated dense bodies resembling lipofuscin of neurons. #> 1229                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             A specialized cell involved in sensory perception of smell. #> 1231                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             An epithelial cell located on the basal lamina of the olfactory epithelium. #> 1233                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                A rounded or elliptical epithelial cell, with pale-staining open face nucleus and pale cytoplasm rich in free ribosomes and clusters of centrioles; form a distinct basal zone spaced slightly from the basal surface of the epithelium. #> 1246                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        A flat or angular epithelial cell with condensed nuclei and darkly staining cytoplasm containing numerous intermediate filaments inserted into desmosomes contacting surrounding supporting cells; lie in contact with the basal lamina of olfactory epithelium. #> 2104                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               A neural-crest derived glial cell that supports the growth and survival of primary olfactory neuroons from the neuroepithelium in the nasal cavity to the brain by encasing large bundles of numerous unmyelinated axons. #> 2476                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 A neuron residing in the olfactory bulb that serve to process and refine signals arising from olfactory sensory neurons #> 2483 The principal glutaminergic neuron located in the outer third of the external plexiform layer of the olfactory bulb; a single short primary dendrite traverses the outer external plexiform layer and terminates within an olfactory glomerulus in a tuft of branches, where it receives the input from olfactory receptor neuron axon terminals; axons of the tufted cells transfer information to a number of areas in the brain, including the piriform cortex, entorhinal cortex, olfactory tubercle, and amygdala. #> 2828                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  A DRD1-expressing medium spiny neuron that is part of a nucleus accumbens shell or olfactory tubercle. #> 2829                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  A DRD2-expressing medium spiny neuron that is part of a nucleus accumbens shell or olfactory tubercle. #> 3054           A tuft cell that is part of the olfactory epithelium, characterized by a globular body and the expression of neurogranin (Nrgn) in mice. This cell plays a crucial role in allergen recognition and regulating olfactory stem cell proliferation via TRPM5-dependent ATP sensing and cysteinyl leukotriene production. Unlike nasal respiratory tuft cells, it has low to absent expression of taste receptors, including the G protein Gα gustducin, and rarely contacts olfactory sensory neurons directly.

title: Clinical Laboratory Measurement Annotations (LOINC) — clinicallab_annotation
text: structured annotation table clinical laboratory tests biomarkers, derived LOINC (Logical Observation Identifiers Names Codes) system. dataset maps LOINC identifiers human-readable test names used within pKOI pipeline annotate graph nodes representing clinical laboratory features.

title: Clinical Laboratory Measurement Annotations (LOINC) — clinicallab_annotation
text: data frame multiple rows 2 columns: identifier character string representing LOINC code (e.g., "2251-7"). name human-readable description laboratory test measurement, including analyte, method, specimen type, timing, scale (e.g., "Estriol:MCnc:Pt:Ser/Plas:Qn").

title: Clinical Laboratory Measurement Annotations (LOINC) — clinicallab_annotation
text: LOINC — Logical Observation Identifiers Names Codes https://loinc.org/

title: Clinical Laboratory Measurement Annotations (LOINC) — clinicallab_annotation
text: dataset supports integration clinical laboratory data biomedical knowledge graphs providing interpretive labels LOINC-coded test results. annotations essential associating molecular phenotypic features clinical diagnostics translational research precision medicine applications. dataset intended joined graph nodes `identifier` values corresponding LOINC codes.

what: Protein and Molecular Complex Annotations — complex_annotation
title: Protein and Molecular Complex Annotations — complex_annotation
text: detailed annotation table known molecular protein complexes, including host-pathogen receptor-ligand assemblies endogenous regulatory complexes. entry provides unique identifier, descriptive name complex, rich textual definition outlining biological roles, composition, functional significance.

title: Protein and Molecular Complex Annotations — complex_annotation
Protein and Molecular Complex Annotations — complex_annotation
text: data frame 3318 rows 3 columns: identifier numeric character string serving unique ID complex (e.g., "2241498559"). name descriptive name complex, including viral-host receptor assemblies protein transcription factor complexes (e.g., "SARS-CoV-2 Spike - human ACE2 receptor complex"). description detailed functional mechanistic summary complex, often including molecular interactions, roles signaling, implications infection transcriptional regulation.

title: Protein and Molecular Complex Annotations — complex_annotation
text: Complex descriptions adapted curated biological databases Reactome literature sources.

title: Protein and Molecular Complex Annotations — complex_annotation
text: dataset particularly useful annotating graph nodes represent biological complexes systems-level analyses. Examples include virus-receptor binding events relevant infectious disease research SMAD family transcriptional complexes involved TGF-beta signaling. annotations can joined analysis outputs run_pkoi using `identifier` column.

title: Protein and Molecular Complex Annotations — complex_annotation
code: data(complex_annotation) subset(complex_annotation, grepl("Spike", name)) #>      identifier                                           name #> 1    3814064568   SARS-CoV Spike - human ACE2 receptor complex #> 2    4062616558   SARS-CoV Spike - human CLEC4M lectin complex #> 3    2241498559 SARS-CoV-2 Spike - human ACE2 receptor complex #> 4    3898566408  SARS-CoV-2 Spike - human ACE2-SLC6A19 complex #> 5    2498369513 SARS-CoV-2 Spike - human CLEC4M lectin complex #> 3318  191534684   MERS-CoV Spike - human DPP4 receptor complex #>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            description #> 1                                                                                                                                                        Binding of SARS-CoV coronavirus Spike protein to human receptor ACE2 facilitates virus entry into host cell.  #> 2      Binding of SARS-CoV coronavirus Spike protein to human lectin CLEC4M expressed on innate immune cells and subsequent internalisation may lead to virus clearance or, on the contrary, result in spread of the virus to susceptible cells, or even other hosts.  #> 3                                                                                                                                                      Binding of SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus Spike protein to human receptor ACE2 facilitates virus entry into host cell.  #> 4                                                          Internalised SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus Spike - human receptor ACE2 complex binds amino acid transporter SLC6A19 (B0AT1). SLC6A19 may play a regulatory role for the enteric infections of some coronaviruses.  #> 5    Binding of SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus Spike protein to human lectin CLEC4M expressed on innate immune cells and subsequent internalisation may lead to virus clearance or, on the contrary, result in spread of the virus to susceptible cells, or even other hosts.  #> 3318                                                                                                                                                         Binding of MERS coronavirus Spike protein to human receptor DPP2 facilitates virus entry into host cell.

title: Chemical Compound Annotations — compound_annotation
text: curated annotation table small molecules chemical compounds used pharmacological, biochemical, research contexts. entry includes standardized identifier (e.g., InChIKey ChEMBL ID) corresponding compound name, available. dataset used within pKOI framework annotate nodes representing chemical entities drugs biological knowledge graphs.

title: Chemical Compound Annotations — compound_annotation
text: data frame 554526 rows 2 columns: identifier character string representing unique compound ID, either InChIKey (e.g., "inchikey:NZLJDTKLZIMONR-UHFFFAOYSA-N") ChEMBL compound accession (e.g., "chembl.compound:CHEMBL5219790"). name human-readable compound name, available (e.g., "ACRIFLAVINE"). Missing values indicate uncharacterized unnamed entries.

title: Chemical Compound Annotations — compound_annotation
text: Data compiled chemical databases ChEMBL InChI registry.

title: Chemical Compound Annotations — compound_annotation
text: dataset enables mapping compound-level features biomedical networks, including chemical perturbagens, drug candidates, environmental exposures. can joined pKOI network results using `identifier` field enrich nodes type "Compound" interpretable names.

title: Chemical Compound Annotations — compound_annotation
code: data(compound_annotation) subset(compound_annotation, grepl("CETRIMIDE", name)) #>                      identifier      name #> 3 chembl.compound:CHEMBL5219790 CETRIMIDE #> 4 chembl.compound:CHEMBL5219942 CETRIMIDE

title: Disease Ontology (DO) Annotations — disease_annotation
text: structured annotation table mapping Disease Ontology (DOID) identifiers human-readable disease names definitions. dataset used pKOI framework annotate network nodes associated disease terms, enabling interpretation enriched prioritized disease-related features biological networks.

title: Disease Ontology (DO) Annotations — disease_annotation
text: data frame 10002 rows 3 columns: identifier character string representing Disease Ontology ID (e.g., "DOID:0040003"). name name disease (e.g., "benzylpenicillin allergy"). definition detailed textual definition disease, including etiology, affected systems, allergy triggers, often references biomedical sources.

title: Disease Ontology (DO) Annotations — disease_annotation
text: Disease Ontology https://disease-ontology.org/

title: Disease Ontology (DO) Annotations — disease_annotation
text: Disease Ontology () provides standardized, ontology-based representation human diseases. dataset allows integration disease concepts biological graphs supports downstream analysis disease associations. `identifier` column serves join key nodes type "Disease" pKOI networks, `definition` column provides biological clinical context.

title: Enzyme Commission (EC) Number Annotations — ec_annotation
text: reference annotation table mapping Enzyme Commission (EC) numbers enzyme names. dataset used pKOI framework annotate biological network nodes associated enzymatic activity.

title: Enzyme Commission (EC) Number Annotations — ec_annotation
text: data frame 8764 rows 2 columns: identifier character string representing EC number (e.g., "1.1.1.196"). EC numbers classify enzymes chemical reactions catalyze. name full enzyme name (e.g., "15-hydroxyprostaglandin-D dehydrogenase (NADP+)"). missing (`NA`), enzyme identifier corresponding name source.

text: IUBMB Enzyme Nomenclature https://enzyme.expasy.org/

text: EC numbers standardized nomenclature enzymes, maintained IUBMB. dataset supports functional interpretation nodes pKOI network enzymatic roles. `identifier` column used link graph nodes type "EC", `name` column provides descriptive labels downstream analysis visualization.

what: Get Neighboring Nodes in a Network — get_neighboring_nodes
title: Get Neighboring Nodes in a Network — get_neighboring_nodes
text: Retrieves nodes within specified number hops (degree expansion) given node network. useful defining local subgraphs identifying nodes immediate extended neighborhood protein node.

title: Get Neighboring Nodes in a Network — get_neighboring_nodes
Get Neighboring Nodes in a Network — get_neighboring_nodes
text: protein_node_id character string corresponding name (ID) protein node graph. degree_expansion integer indicating many hops away node include neighborhood. example, `degree_expansion = 1` returns direct neighbors, `degree_expansion = 2` returns nodes two steps away. subnetwork `igraph` object representing graph extract neighbors. Default `pkoi::pkoi_net`.

title: Get Neighboring Nodes in a Network — get_neighboring_nodes
text: character vector node IDs representing neighboring nodes within specified degree expansion.

title: Gene Ontology (GO) Term Annotations — go_annotation
text: comprehensive annotation table Gene Ontology (GO) terms, including biological process, molecular function, cellular component namespaces. dataset supports interpretation functional enrichment graph nodes labeled GO identifiers within pKOI framework.

title: Gene Ontology (GO) Term Annotations — go_annotation
text: data frame 47,921 rows 4 columns: identifier character string representing GO identifier (e.g., "GO:0000001"). name name GO term (e.g., "mitochondrion inheritance"). namespace ontology category term belongs, one `"biological_process"`, `"molecular_function"`, `"cellular_component"`. definition textual definition GO term, often including references source attributions.

title: Gene Ontology (GO) Term Annotations — go_annotation
text: Gene Ontology Consortium http://geneontology.org/

title: Gene Ontology (GO) Term Annotations — go_annotation
text: dataset enables mapping functional annotations nodes biological knowledge graph particularly useful characterizing enriched terms network-based analyses performed run_pkoi. GO terms marked "obsolete" included completeness may require special handling analysis.

title: Gene Ontology (GO) Term Annotations — go_annotation
code: data(go_annotation) table(go_annotation$namespace) #>  #> biological_process cellular_component           external molecular_function  #>              30741               4525                  1              12654  head(go_annotation[go_annotation$namespace == "molecular_function", ]) #>   identifier                                                     name #> 4 GO:0000005                    obsolete ribosomal chaperone activity #> 5 GO:0000006    high-affinity zinc transmembrane transporter activity #> 6 GO:0000007 low-affinity zinc ion transmembrane transporter activity #> 7 GO:0000008                                     obsolete thioredoxin #> 8 GO:0000009                   alpha-1,6-mannosyltransferase activity #> 9 GO:0000010                heptaprenyl diphosphate synthase activity #>            namespace #> 4 molecular_function #> 5 molecular_function #> 6 molecular_function #> 7 molecular_function #> 8 molecular_function #> 9 molecular_function #>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      definition #> 4                                                                                                                                                                                              OBSOLETE. Assists in the correct assembly of ribosomes or ribosomal subunits in vivo, but is not a component of the assembled ribosome when performing its normal biological function."" [GOC:jl, PMID:12150913] #> 5                                                                                                                                     Enables the transfer of zinc ions (Zn2+) from one side of a membrane to the other, probably powered by proton motive force. In high-affinity transport the transporter is able to bind the solute even if it is only present at very low concentrations."" [TC:2.A.5.1.1] #> 6                                                                          Enables the transfer of a solute or solutes from one side of a membrane to the other according to the reaction: Zn2+ = Zn2+, probably powered by proton motive force. In low-affinity transport the transporter is able to bind the solute only if it is present at very high concentrations."" [GOC:mtg_transport, ISBN:0815340729] #> 7 OBSOLETE. A small disulfide-containing redox protein that serves as a general protein disulfide oxidoreductase. Interacts with a broad range of proteins by a redox mechanism, based on the reversible oxidation of 2 cysteine thiol groups to a disulfide, accompanied by the transfer of 2 electrons and 2 protons. The net result is the covalent interconversion of a disulfide and a dithiol."" [GOC:kd] #> 8                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Catalysis of the transfer of a mannose residue to an oligosaccharide, forming an alpha-(1->6) linkage."" [GOC:mcc, PMID:2644248] #> 9                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         Catalysis of the reaction: (2E,6E)-farnesyl diphosphate + 4 isopentenyl diphosphate = 4 diphosphate + all-trans-heptaprenyl diphosphate."" [PMID:9708911, RHEA:27794]

title: Human miRNA Annotations (miRBase-style) — mirna_annotation
text: curated dataset mapping human mature miRNA identifiers corresponding miRBase precursor accessions.

title: Human miRNA Annotations (miRBase-style) — mirna_annotation
text: data frame two columns multiple rows (1 per miRNA): identifier Character string representing mature miRNA ID, including species prefix (e.g., `"hsa-miR-6129"`). accession miRBase accession number precursor miRNA hairpin (e.g., `"MI0021274"`).

title: Human miRNA Annotations (miRBase-style) — mirna_annotation
text: Extracted parsed version miRBase release data.

title: Human miRNA Annotations (miRBase-style) — mirna_annotation

title: Pathway Annotations (WikiPathways) — pathway_annotation
text: curated annotation table mapping biological pathway identifiers pathway names. annotations derived primarily WikiPathways describe metabolic, signaling, disease-related pathways relevant cellular physiological processes. dataset used pKOI framework annotate nodes type "Pathway" biological knowledge graphs.

title: Pathway Annotations (WikiPathways) — pathway_annotation
text: data frame 4831 rows 2 columns: identifier character string representing pathway ID, typically WikiPathways (e.g., "WP2875"). name human-readable name pathway (e.g., "Constitutive androstane receptor pathway").

title: Pathway Annotations (WikiPathways) — pathway_annotation
text: WikiPathways https://www.wikipathways.org/

title: Pathway Annotations (WikiPathways) — pathway_annotation
text: Pathways describe sets molecular interactions regulatory events carry defined biological functions. dataset enables biological interpretation functional enrichment graph nodes associated pathway membership influence. `identifier` column used map pathway node IDs graph analyses (e.g., run_pkoi), `name` column provides context labeling visualization.

title: Protein Annotations (UniProt-Based) — protein_annotation
text: reference annotation table mapping protein identifiers gene symbols functional descriptions. dataset derived primarily UniProt related sources, used within pKOI framework annotate nodes type "Protein" biological knowledge graphs.

title: Protein Annotations (UniProt-Based) — protein_annotation
text: data frame 194076 rows 3 columns: identifier character string representing UniProt protein accession (e.g., "A0A023HJ61"). name gene symbol short name protein (e.g., "RAB4A"). may `NA` uncharacterized unnamed proteins. description textual description protein’s function classification, including enzyme commission (EC) numbers, available (e.g., "ATP synthase subunit ").

title: Protein Annotations (UniProt-Based) — protein_annotation
text: UniProt https://www.uniprot.org/

title: Protein Annotations (UniProt-Based) — protein_annotation
text: dataset supports interpretation graph-based analyses providing biological context protein nodes. Descriptions derived automated curated functional annotations RuleBase ECO evidence codes. `identifier` column intended used join key protein-related nodes pKOI network output, `description` field adds depth functional interpretation.

what: Run pKOI Network Enrichment Analysis — run_pkoi
title: Run pKOI Network Enrichment Analysis — run_pkoi
text: function performs network enrichment analysis using personalized PageRank framework knowledge-graph-based protein interaction network. input differential proteomics data output list node-wise enrichment statistics various biological node types (e.g., anatomy, disease, GO terms) annotated based proximity relevance significant protein hits network.

title: Run pKOI Network Enrichment Analysis — run_pkoi
code: run_pkoi(   proteomics_data,   pvalue_threshold = 0.01,   logfc_threshold = 0,   topology_by = "degree",   topology_similarity = 0.9,   n_permutation = 10,   damping_factor = 0.85,   maximum_iteration = 500,   subnetwork = pkoi::pkoi_net,   include_subnetwork = FALSE )

title: Run pKOI Network Enrichment Analysis — run_pkoi
text: proteomics_data `data.frame` containing differential proteomics results. Must include columns: uniprot_id Unique UniProt identifier protein. logfc Log fold-change values. p_value P-values differential expression. pvalue_threshold numeric threshold filtering proteins based statistical significance (default = 0.01). logfc_threshold numeric threshold filtering proteins based magnitude log fold-change (default = 0). topology_by character string indicating network topology metric use selecting topologically matched sham proteins. Valid options include: `"degree"` Number direct neighbors (node connectivity). `"coreness"` k-core number indicating deeply embedded node network core. `"betweenness"` Number shortest paths passing node (bridge centrality). `"closeness"` Inverse sum shortest path lengths node others (centrality via proximity). `"constraint"` Measure structurally constrained node neighbors (network redundancy). `"eccentricity"` Maximum shortest path distance node node (network reach). `"eigen_centrality"` Centrality measure accounting influence neighbors (similar Google's PageRank). `"transitivity"` Local clustering coefficient indicating tendency form triangles (closed triplets). metrics precomputed nodes graph using `igraph::vertex_attr()`. topology_similarity numeric value 0 1 specifying tolerance selecting topologically similar sham proteins (default = 0.9). value closer 1 enforces tighter matching. n_permutation Integer specifying number null simulations generate empirical background distributions (default = 10). damping_factor numeric damping factor personalized PageRank algorithm (default = 0.85). maximum_iteration Maximum number iterations allowed PageRank convergence (default = 500). subnetwork `igraph` object representing subnetwork analyze. Default `pkoi::pkoi_net`. include_subnetwork Logical; whether include full subnetwork part returned S4 object (default = FALSE).

title: Run pKOI Network Enrichment Analysis — run_pkoi
text: `pKOIList` S4 object containing: proteomics_data input proteomics data. network_summary_statistics named list data.frames containing enrichment statistics per node type (e.g., Anatomy, Disease). subnetwork (Optional) input network graph, `include_subnetwork = TRUE`. parameters Parameters used analysis.

title: Run pKOI Network Enrichment Analysis — run_pkoi
text: function proceeds several stages: Filters proteomics data significance. Maps significant proteins graph calculates weighted personalized vector. Performs personalized PageRank. Generates null distributions using topologically matched sham proteins. Computes z-score empirical p-values graph nodes. Annotates enriched nodes using built-ontologies returns annotated result.
